skill.name: reporting-issues
skill.description: Use this skill when you need to report on a troubleshooting session
skill.summary: Generate structured troubleshooting reports from debugging sessions
skill.author: Emz1998

Manual review confirms this is benign YAML frontmatter describing the skill's purpose. No cryptographic code, algorithms, or security-sensitive patterns exist in the skill files. The skill is a simple documentation wrapper that references another agent for report generation.

content.value_statement: Transform debugging sessions into structured, shareable reports. This skill helps document issues, solutions, and findings for team knowledge sharing and future reference.
actual_capabilities: Generates structured troubleshooting reports from debugging sessions
Documents issue symptoms, root cause, and resolution steps
Creates shareable reports for team knowledge sharing
Organizes findings in a clear, reproducible format
Captures context for future reference and debugging
limitations: Requires the @troubleshoot-report-generator agent to be available
Does not perform actual troubleshooting itself
Cannot access external systems or logs directly
Relies on provided session information for report generation

use_cases.title: Document customer support issues
use_cases.description: Transform support ticket conversations into structured reports that capture the full problem history, troubleshooting steps taken, and final resolution for knowledge base entries.
use_cases.target_user: Support team leads and technical writers

use_cases.title: Create sprint retrospective reports
use_cases.description: After incident response sessions, generate reports summarizing what went wrong, how it was fixed, and preventive measures for team retrospectives and process improvement.

use_cases.title: Build personal debugging logs
use_cases.description: Keep a personal log of complex debugging sessions with clear documentation of the problem, investigation steps, and solution for future reference when similar issues arise.

prompt_templates.title: Basic issue report
prompt_templates.prompt:
Use the @reporting-issues skill to create a troubleshooting report from this debugging session:

[Describe the issue, steps taken, and outcome]
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick report generation from a simple debugging session

prompt_templates.title: Detailed incident report
prompt_templates.prompt:
Generate a comprehensive troubleshooting report using @reporting-issues. Include:

- Initial problem description
- All debugging steps performed
- Key findings and observations
- Final resolution
- Recommendations for prevention
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating detailed incident documentation for complex issues

prompt_templates.title: Knowledge base entry
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a troubleshooting report with @reporting-issues formatted for a knowledge base. Make it reproducible by including exact commands used and environment details.

prompt_templates.title: Team handoff report
prompt_templates.prompt: Use @reporting-issues to document this debugging session for handoff to another team. Include context, current status, and next steps.
prompt_templates.scenario: Handing off unresolved issues to other team members

output_examples.input: Use @reporting-issues to document this session where I fixed the database connection timeout issue by increasing the pool size.
output: Database connection timeouts occurring under load
Connection pool size was too small for concurrent requests
Increased pool size from 10 to 50 connections
Tested with 100 concurrent users, no timeouts observed

best_practices: Include specific error messages and timestamps when describing issues
Document both what was tried and why it did not work
Add environmental context like versions, configs, and system details
anti_patterns: Skipping the root cause analysis and only documenting the fix
Using vague descriptions like it broke or it did not work
Failing to verify the fix before closing the session

faq.question: What does the reporting-issues skill actually do?
faq.answer: This skill invokes the @troubleshoot-report-generator agent to create a structured report from your debugging session. It organizes the information you provide into a clear format with issue summary, root cause, and resolution sections.

faq.question: Do I need to install anything to use this skill?
faq.answer: No additional installation is required. The skill simply calls another agent that should be available in your Claude Code environment.

faq.question: Can this skill troubleshoot issues automatically?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates reports from information you provide. It does not perform diagnostic steps or access systems directly.

faq.question: What makes a good troubleshooting report?
faq.answer: A good report includes specific error messages, step-by-step actions taken, environmental details, the root cause discovery, and verification that the fix works.

faq.question: Can I export reports to different formats?
faq.answer: The skill generates markdown output that can be copied to any markdown-compatible tool, knowledge base, or documentation system.

faq.question: Is this skill suitable for team collaboration?
faq.answer: Yes. The generated reports are ideal for sharing with team members, adding to documentation, or creating a searchable knowledge base of past issues.
